The Mercury-gallant containing many true and pleasant relations of what hath passed at Paris, from the first of January 1672. Till the Kings departure thence. Translated from the French. J. D.
[22], 159, [1] p.
printed by T.R. and N.T. for Dorman Newman at the Kings Arms in the Poultry, and Jonathan Edwin at the Three Roses in Ludgate-street, London : 1673.
Dedication signed: J.D. French original not traced. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
